intro: Primula ianthina, commonly known as the purple primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive violet to purple petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and meadows. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is also threatened by habitat loss.
